title: 'Chinki, momo, Chinese': How everyday racism shadows Indians from the Northeast
content: Northeastern Indians face persistent racial slurs and discrimination across India, from casual prejudice to fatal violence. Incidents like Anjel Chakma's death highlight how stereotypes about appearance and food habits lead to abuse and exclusion, even in supposedly cosmopolitan cities calling for stronger laws and societal change to foster true inclusivity.

title: J&K: Suspected Pak drones spotted along LoC near Rajouri, Poonch districts
content: Suspected drones were detected entering Indian airspace from Pakistan along the International Border and Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, Rajouri, and Poonch districts on Sunday evening. Security forces observed the objects hovering for a few minutes before returning, prompting ground search operations and firing in some areas.

title: IND vs NZ: India survive late scare; Kohli's 93 anchors four-wicket win over Black Caps
content: India were well placed for most of the chase and appeared in control until Kohli‚Äôs dismissal in the 40th over. At that stage, India needed 67 runs from 66 balls with seven wickets in hand. However, New Zealand struck back quickly, picking up wickets to put pressure on the hosts.

title: Iran denies arresting Indian nationals amid protests; Ambassador calls it 'fake'
content: Iran's ambassador to India has branded reports of Iranian police arresting Indian nationals as "fake," urging reliance on credible sources. These rumors emerged amidst ongoing protests across Iran, which have plunged the nation into political and economic uncertainty. The alleged detentions, if true, would involve 10 Afghans and 6 Indians, purportedly linked to recent rioting in Abadan.

title: Microsoft AI CEO: We're building superintelligence backwards; need controls before trust
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: 'Need more time': What US military told Trump on Iran invasion?
content: US military commanders have warned President Trump that more time is needed to prepare for potential strikes against Iran amid escalating protests. Commanders are urging consolidation of US military positions and defenses before any action that could provoke retaliation.

title: 'Completely not okay': Google chief scientist Jeff Dean on ICE arrest of teens in Minnesota
content: Google scientist Jeff Dean has strongly condemned recent arrests by ICE and Border Patrol. He called the actions horrific and unconstitutional. This statement drew a response from X owner Elon Musk, who questioned the evidence presented. The controversy involves viral videos of detentions and a fatal shooting incident in Minnesota.

title: Iran protest: At least 500 dead in crackdown; Tehran warns US, Israel of consequences
content: Iran's crackdown on nationwide protests has reportedly killed over 538, with thousands detained amid an internet blackout. Tehran has warned the US and Israel of "legitimate targets" if force is used to protect demonstrators. Protests persist despite heavy security, fueled by economic collapse and calls challenging the theocratic system.

title: When disasters strike, preparation saves lives ‚Äî is India ready when crisis hits?
content: India faces escalating disaster risks due to geography, climate change, and development patterns, as starkly illustrated in 2025 by devastating floods and heatwaves. While response capacity has improved, a persistent imbalance favors reactive relief over proactive preparedness, a gap highlighted by contrasting events like Cyclone Phailin and Bihar's recurring floods.

title: China investigates Meta-Manus deal: Commerce ministry probes $2bn AI buy; Meta denies China links
content: Meta's acquisition of AI startup Manus, with Chinese roots, is under investigation by China for potential violations of technology export and outbound investment laws.  Despite Manus's move to Singapore and Meta's clarification on no continuing Chinese ownership, Beijing is scrutinizing the deal, citing the company's founding and parentage.

title: Record! India's Nandani becomes first player ever to achieve this feat
content: Nandani Sharma created WPL history with a sensational spell for Delhi Capitals against Gujarat Giants in Navi Mumbai. The Chandigarh pacer became the first player to take a five-wicket haul and a hat-trick in a single WPL match. Her pace and accuracy turned the game, marking her arrival as a rising star in Indian women‚Äôs cricket.

title: No Rahul-Stalin in Tamil Nadu? DMK rejects Cong‚Äòs 'sharing power‚Äô proposal; CM firm on stand
content: Senior DMK leader I Periyasamy has firmly ruled out any coalition government in Tamil Nadu, stating chief minister M K Stalin is resolute against sharing power with allies, including the Congress. This assertion comes as the Tamil Nadu Congress renews its demand for a share in governance ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
content: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
content: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.

title: Greenland row: EU floats idea of 100,000-strong joint force; aims to cut reliance on US troops
content: EU defence commissioner Andrius Kubilius proposed a 100,000-strong joint European military force to potentially replace US troops, citing concerns over Washington's long-term commitment. He also advocated for a European Security Council to expedite defence decisions, with Ukraine's war as a top priority.

title: Noah Gray net worth: Chiefs TE contract, salary, and earnings
content: Noah Gray, Kansas City Chiefs tight end, built a successful NFL career through reliability and consistent performance. Drafted in the fifth round, his steady play earned him an important contract extension, securing his financial future. Gray's story shows how dedication and dependability can lead to long-term security in sports.

title: ‚ÄòRestoring connectivity‚Äô: First India-assisted Bailey Bridge opens in cyclone-hit Sri Lanka
content: India has opened the first Bailey Bridge in Sri Lanka, restoring a vital link between Central and Uva provinces following Cyclone Ditwah. Constructed by the Indian Army, this 100-foot bridge is part of a $450 million reconstruction package. Over 15 more bridges are planned, alongside railway line repairs, demonstrating India's commitment to Sri Lanka's recovery.

title: Exclusive: Alexx, Vishakha & Kashika on Bollywood's unseen battles and the reforms it
content: Bollywood is an industry that thrives on spectacle. Headlines are dominated by opening-day numbers, star fees, social media virality and box-office verdicts delivered within hours of a release. This ETimes piece moves the spotlight away from gossip and toward growth. By listening closely to voices from within the industry‚Äîactor Alexx O‚ÄôNell, actor-producer-entrepreneur Vishakha Singh and actor Kashika Kapoor‚Äîit explores the invisible pressures Bollywood normalises, the silences it rewards, and the reforms that could make it a healthier ecosystem for the next generation.

title: ‚ÄòWhy did she go there?‚Äô: How the onus of safety keeps falling on women
content: Public discourse on sexual violence consistently shifts blame from perpetrators to victims, focusing on women's choices and behavior rather than men's decisions. Despite widespread criticism, this regressive mindset persists across politics, courts, and families, implying women must alter their lives to prevent crimes they do not commit.

title: After Venezuela, Cuba next? Trump issues 'no more oil or money' ultimatum
content: US President Donald Trump has warned Cuba to strike a deal, stating that Venezuelan oil and money will cease flowing to Havana. He claimed that recent US actions have devastated Cuba's economy, leaving it with no income. Trump also hinted at potential political changes in Cuba, responding positively to a suggestion of Rubio leading the nation.

title: 4,4,6,6,6,6: Devine intervention at DY Patil; Sophie carnage lights up WPL - Watch
content: Gujarat Giants opener Sophie Devine unleashed a devastating 32-run over against Delhi Capitals' Sneh Rana, propelling her to a rapid half-century. Devine's explosive innings of 95 runs off 42 balls, including six sixes in one over, was the highlight of the match. She narrowly missed a century as Gujarat Giants posted a strong total.

title: Massive! Rohit scripts history, surpasses Gayle to pocket this record
content: Rohit Sharma created history in the first ODI against New Zealand by becoming the leading six-hitter among openers in ODI cricket, surpassing Chris Gayle. He also became the first player to hit 650 international sixes. Rohit scored 26 runs, while New Zealand posted 300/8 after a strong start led by their openers.

title: From Cambodia to Delhi: How a SIM box network defrauded India of Rs 100 crore; 7 arrested
content: Delhi Police arrested seven individuals linked to a transnational cybercrime syndicate using illegal SIM box technology. The group, with ties to Chinese, Cambodian, and Pakistani scam networks, defrauded thousands of victims of approximately Rs 100 crore through a "digital arrest" scam. Investigations revealed a sophisticated international operation involving SIM box installations and IMEI manipulation.

title: Controversy! Bangar calls Hindi ‚Äònational language of India‚Äô; faces backlash
content: Sanjay Bangar sparked controversy during the first IND vs NZ ODI by calling Hindi the ‚Äúnational language of India‚Äù on air. The remark, made during a discussion involving KL Rahul and Washington Sundar, drew heavy social media backlash, with fans pointing out that India has no national language. Meanwhile, New Zealand posted 300/8, led by Daryl Mitchell‚Äôs 84.

title: Iran president accuses US, Israel as protests turn violent; at least 200 killed
content: Iranian President Pezeshkian accused the US and Israel of orchestrating unrest, even as he acknowledged public grievances and warned against rioters. Protests, initially economic, have evolved into a challenge to the theocratic system, with rights groups reporting a rising death toll and detentions amid an internet blackout.

title: ‚ÄòWhere has its nationalism gone?‚Äô: Owaisi attacks Centre over Chinese investments
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned the BJP government's nationalism, citing its invitation to Chinese companies despite security concerns and its silence on US President Donald Trump's alleged insults. Owaisi also criticized the Centre's asylum for Sheikh Hasina and the prolonged incarceration of Muslim youth without trial.

title: Phillips defies physics at point; Kohli can‚Äôt believe his eyes ‚Äî watch
content: The moment came in the eighth over of India‚Äôs innings. Gill, batting on eight, attempted a cut shot off the fourth ball of Zak Foulkes‚Äô over. The delivery was back of a length and outside the off stump. Gill stayed back and hit the ball hard towards the backward point region. Phillips moved quickly to his left, jumped and stretched out his left hand while airborne.

title: ‚ÄòLegitimate targets‚Äô: Iran warns US of retaliation; Israel on alert ‚Äî will Trump order a strike?
content: Iran's leadership faces escalating protests, now in their third week, with over 116 reported deaths. Amidst this unrest, Israel is on high alert as US President Trump reportedly considers military action. Iran has issued a stern warning, deeming regional US bases and Israel as 'legitimate targets' if attacked.

title: Chicago Bears hit by major playoff injury blow as TJ Edwards, Ozzy Trapilo ruled out
content: The Chicago Bears' Wild Card victory over the Packers was marred by season-ending injuries to linebacker T.J. Edwards (fractured fibula) and offensive tackle Ozzy Trapilo (patellar tendon). Both starters are out for the remainder of the postseason, forcing the Bears to rely on depth as they navigate the playoffs.

title: Bangladeshi umpire officiates IND vs NZ ODI amid Mustafizur row - who is he?
content: As per ICC regulations, umpires for ODIs are appointed under specific clauses. Clause 2.1.4 states that the ICC shall appoint one umpire for each ODI, who must not be from the same country as the participating teams and must be from the Elite Panel or International Panel. Clause 2.1.5 says the home board shall appoint one umpire.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen‚Äôs family preferred Tom Brady over Joaquim Valente: Report
content: Gisele B√ºndchen‚Äôs family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple‚Äôs happiness and growing family. While B√ºndchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.

title: Watch: Fire breaks out in cinema hall in Odisha; major mishap averted
content: A minor fire broke out at Ashok Talkies in Rayagada during the screening of 'The Raja Saab', causing brief panic among moviegoers. The incident occurred when an aarti plate slipped and fell on papers near the screen, igniting them. Prompt action by staff and audience members quickly extinguished the flames, with no injuries or damage reported.

title: Tej Pratap renews Bharat Ratna push for Lalu; will invite CM Nitish for ‚Äòchoora-dahi bhoj‚Äô
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, chief of Janshakti Janta Dal, has once again demanded the Bharat Ratna for his father, former Bihar CM Lalu Prasad Yadav. He announced plans to formally write to the government, supporting his sister's recent social media remarks.

title: Drama at sacked IAS Puja Khedkar‚Äôs home: Family allegedly tied up, drugged & robbed ‚Äî how it unfolded
content: Pune police are investigating claims by former IAS probationer Puja Khedkar. She alleges a recently hired domestic help from Nepal drugged her and her parents, tied them up, and stole valuables and mobile phones from their Baner Road residence. Khedkar managed to free herself and alert authorities.

title: Iran unrest: France No. 1 Firouzja shares powerful message ‚Äî 'Live free or die'
content: French No. 1 chess grandmaster Alireza Firouzja drew global attention after posting ‚ÄúLong live Iran‚Äù on social media and sharing the monarchial-era Iranian flag. The post was linked to ongoing protests and a humanitarian crisis in Iran. Though now a French citizen, Firouzja‚Äôs message showed strong solidarity with Iranians and highlighted his deep emotional ties to his country of birth.

title: Source: Stafford to have tests on injured finger
content: Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford will undergo tests Sunday on an injured finger, a source told ESPN.

title: Panthers LT Ekwonu (knee) to miss 6-12 months
content: Panthers starting left tackle Ickey Ekwonu suffered a ruptured patellar tendon in his right knee in Saturday's playoff loss. With a recovery time of 6-12 months, coach Dave Canales said the injury will force the team to alter its offseason plans.

title: Bears' Johnson in viral speech: 'F--- the Packers!'
content: A fired-up Ben Johnson yelled "F--- the Packers" during his postgame locker room speech after the Bears' historic comeback victory.

title: Coveted portal WR Coleman transfers to Texas
content: Cam Coleman, the No. 2 player in ESPN's transfer portal rankings who had 708 receiving yards and five TDs for Auburn last season, is transferring to Texas.

title: Deflated LaFleur deflects job talk after Pack loss
content: Deflated after his team's stunning 31-27 loss to the Chicago Bears on Saturday night, Green Bay coach Matt LaFleur told reporters that he wants to remain Packers coach, but he declined to say whether he expected to return next season for an eighth year.

title: Sources: Bregman to Cubs on 5-year, $175M deal
content: Third baseman Alex Bregman and the Chicago Cubs agreed to a five-year, $175 million contract Saturday, sources told ESPN.

title: C's Brown rips refs after loss: 'I'll take the fine'
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown was furious with the officiating in his team's 100-95 loss to the Spurs, saying he's tired of not getting the same calls as the opponent.

content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 20 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

content: Niners-Eagles? Chargers-Pats? Texans-Steelers? We have picks, predictions and stats to know for every remaining wild-card game.

content: The young QB quickly formed a bond with the returning OC, and it took the Patriots to the playoffs (8 p.m. ET).

title: How the Steelers forged Aaron Rodgers-Mike Tomlin connection
content: The bond between veteran QB and coach has led Pittsburgh to its first home playoff game since the 2020 season.

content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: Solak: The Bears are a second-half team, and you can never count them out
content: Perhaps we shouldn't be surprised the Bears came back to beat the Packers. They've been doing this all season.

content: Barcelona and Real Madrid meet in the Supercopa final on Sunday, but who has the upper hand? Sam Marsden and Alex Kirkland preview the upcoming Clasico.

content: The Bulldogs are a few SEC losses away from the wrong side of the bubble due to a number of low-quality wins.

content: LSU has work to do after its 0-2 start in SEC play, but opportunity arrives with the season's most crucial two-game stretch.

content: Did your favorite team miss out on the biggest stars of this winter? Here are 15 players to sign instead.

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings midway through the offseason.

title: 'We're all using it as motivation': LSU aims to shake off last season and win again
content: Last year, the defending champion Tigers were edged out of finals. Now they're back -- with a plan to win the national title again.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: Jaguars' all teal, Panthers' all black lead NFL wild-card weekend uniforms
content: The NFL's wild-card round kicks off Saturday with multiple teams opting for traditional uniform combinations.

title: NFL wild-card round: Expect a tight game between 49ers and Eagles
content: Odds, game picks, prop plays, betting advice and daily fantasy tips for the 49ers-Eagles wild-card matchup.

content: We go on record picking this year's champions, beginning with the CFP and ending with the World Series.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona want Marcus Rashford stay
content: Barcelona want Marcus Rashford to stick around, and Bruno Fernandes also leave Manchester United this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: ‚ÄòSuperstar‚Äô Krishna‚Äôs bond with Vijayawada cast in bronze at Lenin Centre
content: Vijayawada MP recalls the veteran actor‚Äôs deep bond with the city as a bronze statue portraying his Ram Raju role from Eenadu is unveiled

title: Tribal Affairs Ministry in talks with Environment Ministry to fund community forest resource management committees
content: Move necessary to ‚Äòcorrect the perception‚Äô that the forest bureaucracy was at odds with the goals of community-led forest resource management, officials say

title: Right time to buy immovable property in Andhra Pradesh, says RERA chairman
content: Rise in investments is an indication that the construction sector is getting back on track, says Siva Reddy

title: Chennai Metro Rail train chugs along from Porur to Vadapalani
content: The Chennai Metro Rail Limited conducted a trial run after the elevated viaduct from¬†Porur¬†to¬†Vadapalani¬†was completed. The section¬†includes a 4-km double-decker line from¬† Alwarthirunagar¬†to¬†Alapakkam¬†¬†

title: Six years after law amended, Centre yet to constitute Arbitration Council of India
content: Senior officials in the Union Law Ministry said it took years for corporates and public sector undertakings to shun ad-hoc arbitration and go far institutional arbitration to settle commercial disputes

title: RSS evolving with time, taking new forms: Mohan Bhagwat
content: The RSS chief was addressing an event held at the organisation‚Äôs office here to launch the song album of the upcoming film Shatak, which chronicles the 100-year journey of the RSS

title: Trinamool‚Äôs campaign song for Assembly election plays up Bengali identity, language
content: The party‚Äôs three-minute, 13-second campaign song titled ‚ÄòJotoi koro hamla, abar jitbe Bangla‚Äô (attack as much you can, Bengal will win again)

title: Mehbooba Mufti takes exception to NSA Ajit Doval‚Äôs ‚Äòrevenge for history‚Äô remark
content: Calling for revenge in the 21st century over centuries-old events is merely a dog whistle, inciting poor and uneducated youth to target a minority community, Ms. Mufti said.

title: Faster, demand-led approach needed for PSE privatisation: CII
content: In its proposals for the Union Budget 2026-27, the industry lobby calls for a rolling three-year pipeline, outlining which enterprises are likely to be taken up for privatisation during this period

title: Bhairav Battalions to make Army Day Parade debut in Jaipur on January 15
content: Two battalions of the special force will participate in this year‚Äôs parade‚ÄîSouthern Command‚Äôs 2 Bhairav Battalion, known as the ‚ÄòDesert Falcons‚Äô, and South Western Command‚Äôs 4 Bhairav Battalion

title: Indian Army officer from Bengaluru wins UN Secretary General‚Äôs Award 2025
content: Under her initiative and command, the team successfully conducted short- and long-distance patrols, integrated reverie patrols, and dynamic air patrols to far-flung counties of the host nation

title: Grok AI issue: X ‚Äòaccepts its mistake‚Äô, assures it will comply with Indian laws, say government sources
content: Around 3,500 pieces of content have been blocked, and over 600 accounts deleted, according to sources

title: WRD begins construction of 2 new check dams across Palar in Tirupattur
content: The ‚Çπ77.30-crore project will also involve repairs of two existing check dams across the river at Jafrabad and Kondai Oosi villages near Ambur town. The project is being funded by the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development

title: As German Chancellor Merz lands in Gujarat, activists demand that Modi ask for Ariha‚Äôs return
content: Officials say Ariha is meeting parents, Indian embassy in Germany regularly, no movement on government request that the five-year-old be brought up in Indian home

title: CM‚Äôs credibility eroded, says Gaurav Gogoi
content: Hitting out at Himanta Biswa Sarma, the State Congress president said Assam cannot continue to be divided by hatred and violence

title: YouTube channel booked for uploading misleading PU exam paper
content: The uploaded content allegedly mimicked the Hindi language preparatory examination paper for PU students scheduled to be held on January 9

title: 50,000 saplings to breathe new life into Nellore, says Narayana
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister says the massive plantation drive is aimed at developing Nellore Assembly constituency into a green lung space and enhancing overall urban greenery

title: Gandikota Festival off to a colourful start in Kadapa
content: Besides the historic fort, the ancient Madhavaraya temple, and the Jama Masjid, an helicopter ride offers visitors a breathtaking view of the gorge that is touted as India‚Äôs equivalent to the Grand Canyon in the U.S.

title: Kerala may go for full-fledged revamp of Waqf Board
content: A Madras HC decision restraining the T.N. Waqf Board from leaving posts vacant prompts Kerala to rethink strategy and to go in for full reconstitution of the board

title: Cattle transported in container trucks ‚Äòrescued‚Äô in Nandyal district
content: The cows were transported in an inhumane manner, allege Allagadda MLA, who along with her brother and followers, intercepted the vehicle near Allagada after receiving information

title: 10th edition of Ni Fest concludes in Thrissur
content: Exhibition of camp works will be held on January 17 and 18 at Nidarshan and on January 23, 24 and 25 at the Fine Arts College Gallery, Thrissur

title: Announce separate municipal corporation for Secunderabad: Srinivas Yadav to govt.
content: Says peaceful rally with around 10,000 participants would be held on January 17 from Secunderabad Railway Station to the Gandhi statue on MG Road to mount pressure on the government

title: ‚ÄòPennu Case‚Äô movie review: An average con drama sans any exciting elements
content: With a protagonist who commits marriage fraud at its centre, Pennu Case fails to use any of the possibilities of the material at hand

title: NHAI creates four Guinness World Records in Andhra Pradesh
content: In association with concessionaire Rajpath Infracon Private Limited, it sets the records, two each on January 6 and 11, in the implementation of the Bengaluru‚ÄìKadapa‚ÄìVijayawada economic corridor

title: Tracing Traffic Violations: Helmetless riding dominates Bengaluru‚Äôs traffic violations in 2025
content: 2025 was also the year that traffic police personnel returned to the streets to book cases, drawing the ire of many

title: PM should speak on jobs not give history lessons, says Priyank Kharge
content: He criticises Union Home Minister Amit Shah for prioritising political destabilisation over border protection and internal security

title: KITE brings a digital makeover to State School Arts Festival
content: From online registration to QR-coded certificates, State School Arts Festival being held in Thrissur is being transformed into a fully smart, technology-driven event

title: Flamingo Festival draws families to Nelapattu Bird Sanctuary near Sullurpeta
content: As migratory birds settle in for the breeding season, Nelapattu attracts visitors from across South India despite logistical challenges

title: TB crest gates installation likely to be completed by the end of May
content: Koppal in-charge Minister Shivraj Tangadagi inspects ongoing gate-replacement work at Tungabhadra Dam

title: Schools up to Class 8 in Noida to remain closed till January 15 due to cold
content: The closure applies to all schools from nursery to Class 8 affiliated with CBSE, ICSE, IB, UP Board and other boards operating in the district

title: It is wrong to compare Siddaramaiah with Urs, says Jagadish Shettar
content: Stating that Siddaramaiah has not done anything of significance, the BJP MP says that infighting in the Congress is affecting governance in the State

title: Hindu faith under attack in Congress rule, says Telangana BJP president
content: Referring to what he described as repeated attacks on temples and incidents involving cow protectors, Ramchander Rao said these were part of a ‚Äúdangerous pattern‚Äù

title: Organ donation in Kerala rises in 2025
content: The number of deceased donors more than doubled to 25, a significant rise from just 11 in 2024. The rise in awareness among the community has contributed to the increase in numbers.

title: Tyagaraja Aradhana Sangeetotsavam concludes on a resonant note
content: Nearly 200 musicians take part in seven-day festival marked by Pancharatna Ganam, nagara sankeertana and Anjaneya Utsavam at the music college

title: Thamarassery Ghat Road continues to witness frequent traffic congestion
content: Following the traffic snarls, authorities temporarily halted timber removal and road-widening works under a ‚Çπ37-crore project at the sixth, seventh and eighth hairpin bends, providing relief to commuters

title: First India-funded Bailey bridge opens for traffic in cyclone-hit Sri Lanka
content: The Indian mission here said that the 100-ft Bailey bridge was constructed by the Indian Army, restoring a vital road link between the Central Province and Uva Province.

title: LDF‚Äôs northern region development rally to begin on Feb. 1
content: The rally aims to mobilise people against what the LDF describes as the anti-people and divisive policies of the BJP-led Central government, while also highlighting the development and welfare initiatives of the LDF government in Kerala

title: Ahead of Union Budget, Karnataka seeks release of dues
content: Ahead of the Union Budget, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has urged the Centre to release its dues and has referred to the economic conditions in the State owing to GST rate rationalization, increased social commitment, change in weather condition, and increasing urbanisation

title: Pawan Kalyan inducted into ‚ÄòKenjutsu‚Äô, a global recognition in Japanese martial arts
content: Credited with multiple international honours, he is one of the few Indian public figures to bridge cinema, classical martial arts, and martial philosophy on the global stage

title: Kozhikode Corporation Council to elect standing committee chairpersons on Jan. 13
content: The LDF has a majority in six of the eight committees; the UDF, despite holding an advantageous position in the council, managed a majority in only one committee and has the same strength as the BJP in another

title: 18 persons linked to ‚Çπ547-crore major cyber fraud arrested in Khammam district
content: A detailed investigation into the case led to the arrest of the kingpin of the cyber fraud and subsequent arrest of 17 other persons for their alleged links with the cyber fraud network, Khammam Police Commissioner said

title: Telangana govt. to resume SLBC tunnel works with advanced technology
content: Officials inform Minister that excavation has, so far, reached 13.94 km from the inlet side and 20.4 km from the outlet, leaving around 9.8 km to be completed

title: Stalin flags ‚Äògrave risks‚Äô posed to the Tamils by the ongoing constitutional reforms in Sri Lanka
content: The Tamil Nadu Chief Minister urges the Government of India to engage diplomatically with the neighbouring country and press for a constitutional process that ‚Äúgenuinely‚Äù addresses Tamil grievances

title: Local bodies race against time to complete 2025-26 development projects
content: A district-level review of the implementation of various projects will be conducted in the coming weeks in consultation with the District Planning Committee

title: 'Even LoP is not safe': BJP on Suvendu convoy 'attack'; MHA seeks report
content: BJP's Suvendu Adhikari accuses the west Bengal police of attacking his convoy . he sits on a 'dharna' in a police station after the alleged attack . senior BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad recalled how he nearly failed to enter west Bengal's Sandeshkhali .

Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Kerala MLA held in 3rd rape case; Congress washes hands of him
content: police said the Palakkad MLA used his position to sexually abuse women . a court sent him to jail after investigators said he could intimidate complainants, influence witnesses and destroy evidence . the latest case stems from an alleged assault on a 31-year-old woman at a hotel in Thiruvalla on April 8, 2024 .

title: 1st Isro launch of 2026 will put another ‚Äòeye in the sky‚Äô tomorrow
content: the rocket will launch an advanced earth observation satellite EOS-N1 (code-named 'Anvesha') it will also be carrying a european demonstrator satellite and 17 other satellites belonging to Indian and foreign agencies . it will help India secure its borders and be used in fields like agriculture, urban mapping and environmental observation .

title: Yunus government says reports on attack on minorities is 'propaganda'
content: the interim govt sought to downplay media reports as attempts "to destroy communal harmony through false propaganda" the government has repeatedly brushed aside reports of incidents related to minorities as propaganda . a communication of a businessman in Narsingdi was promoted as a committee .

title: Ladki Bahin payout on civic poll eve sparks Maharashtra storm
content: Proshun Chakraborty is a seasoned journalist with over 25 years of experience in civic and urban affairs reporting. Currently Editor-Civic Affairs at The Times of India, Nagpur, he leads coverage on municipal governance, public infrastructure, traffic management, RTO affairs, and urban policy shifts. Proshun has built a trusted network across citizens, bureaucracy and political landscape. He is highly respected for his depth in civic journalism and unwavering commitment to public interest reporting. His hobbies include reading, listening to music and travelling. Read More

title: Masood Azhar claims JeM has thousands of suicide bombers in new audio clip
content: Raj Shekhar Jha is a journalist for the Times of India with over a decade of experience in reporting on national security, terrorism, crime and prisons.

title: Sat-com prompts search operation near international border in Jammu‚Äôs Kanachak
content: a joint team of security forces launched a massive search operation . the communication was traced to a Thuraya satellite device around 3pm . no suspicious had been discovered so far, further combing was underway . volunteers were told to keep vigilance, assess situations promptly, and share actionable inputs timely .

title: Punjab Man Found Chopped In Drum Was Injected Before Murder, Reveals Probe
content: Fresh details have surfaced in the brutal murder of a 35-year-old man, whose dismembered body was recovered from an abandoned plot near Jalandhar Bypass on Thursday.

title: 4 Trunk Drains In Rekha Gupta's Plan To Fix Delhi's Waterlogging Issue
content: Delhi Government, under the leadership of Chief Minister Rekha Gupta, has taken a major and far-reaching step to strengthen the city's drainage system as part of its resolve to develop Delhi into a modern, global and developed capital.

title: Thick Layer Of Toxic Froth Resurfaces On Yamuna River In Delhi
content: A thick layer of toxic froth resurfaced at the Yamuna ghat in Kalindi Kunj here on Sunday, making large stretches of the river nearly invisible, even as experts reiterated that it is disruptive for the river's ecology.

title: 'Right To Higher Education Can't Be Curtailed Lightly': Delhi High Court
content: The Delhi High Court has observed that the right to pursue higher or professional education, though not explicitly listed as a fundamental right under the Constitution, imposes an affirmative obligation on governments and cannot be curtailed lightly.

title: Uddhav And Raj Thackeray Launch Joint Attack On BJPs "Fake Hindutva"
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray and his cousin Raj Thackeray on Sunday launched a scathing attack against the BJP over its "fake Hindutva" at a joint rally for civic polls.

title: Yellow Alert Issued As Biting Cold Wave Grips Delhi
content: Biting cold gripped the capital on Sunday as it experienced the first cold wave of the season, with minimum temperatures falling below 3.0 degrees Celsius at some places, according to India Meteorological Department (IMD) officials.

title: Farmer Dies By Suicide After Rs 4-Crore Land Fraud, Names Accused In Video
content: A farmer allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself on Sunday after being duped of Rs 4 crore in a fake land deal in Uttarakhand's Kathgodam area, police said.

title: 538 Killed In Crackdown On Protests In Iran: Report
content: A crackdown on nationwide protests in Iran has killed at least 538 people and even more are feared dead, activists said Sunday.

title: US Citizen's Charity Bag Triggers Bomb Scare At Ministers Bungalow
content: An abandoned bag found near a minister's bungalow in south Mumbai triggered panic on Sunday until police determined that it had been left by a US citizen who wanted to give away his clothes and shoes, officials said.

title: Woman Slapped, Abused By Man On Busy Andhra Road, None Came To Her Rescue
content: A woman in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam district took to social media on Sunday to describe an incident where she was slapped and abused by an unknown man while commuting to her workplace.

title: Chinese Kite Strings Turn Deadly Across Madhya Pradesh
content: The use of banned "Chinese" kite strings, synthetic threads known for their razor-sharp metallic coating, has caused a series of horrific injuries and at least one death across the state, raising urgent concerns over public safety.

title: Embroiled In Ankita Bhandari Murder Case, Ex-MLA Suresh Rathore Charged In Another Matter
content: Former BJP MLA Suresh Rathore, who is already facing several cases in connection with the murder of Ankita Bhandari, has now found himself in one more FIR after a contractor complained against him for not returning his car, Uttarakhand Police said.

title: 'Op Mongoose', 'Cigar Bomb': US' Failed Attempts To Change Regime In Cuba
content: US President Donald Trump has once again turned his focus towards Cuba, suggesting the island should strike a deal with Washington or face severe economic consequences.

title: Ex-CBI Officer's Wife Loses Rs 2.58 Crore To Cyber Fraud
content: In a shocking case of cyber fraud, the wife of former CBI Joint Director and retired IPS officer VV Lakshmi Narayana was allegedly swindled of Rs 2.58 crore by online scammers.

title: Mothers Who Fear Math Pass It On To Kids, Says Sunak-Murty Charity Study
content: Mothers tend to pass on their own anxiety over mathematics to their daughters, creating a gender gap of confidence in the subject over time, new research has discovered.

title: Bengaluru Techie, Found Dead A Week Ago, Was Killed By A Teen
content: A week after a software engineer was found dead in her rented house in Bengaluru, investigators have revealed she was killed by an 18-year-old man after she resisted his sexual advances.

title: Team Uddhav Leader On Hindutva, Marathi Manoos, Thackeray Reunion
content: The Shiv Sena of the old days was very different from what a section of it is today, Arvind Sawant, senior leader of the Shiv Sena UBT, made it clear today, offering a more nuanced perspective of contentious terms like bhumiputra (sons of the soil)

title: NDTV Power Play: Top Leaders Share Their Vision For Maharashtra
content: Several leaders shared their vision for Maharashtra's future including its politics at NDTV's Power Play on Sunday.

title: Pawan Kalyan Is Now "Tiger Of Martial Arts" After Induction Into 'Kenjutsu'
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has earned for himself a unique honour in the field of Japanese martial arts.

title: Man, 31, Used Matrimonial Sites To Finance His 'Luxury Life', Arrested
content: The Delhi Police has arrested a 31-year-old man from Punjab for allegedly cheating women by posing as a prospective groom on matrimonial websites and social media platforms, an official said on Sunday.

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: the WNBA CBA is scheduled to expire at 11:59 p.m. ET on friday . the league and its players union will likely enter into a stage of "status quo" a work stoppage or lockout can be declared without notice . sources say negotiations have netted minimal progress .

title: Semifinal takeaways: Utter dominance has become the norm for Indiana
content: Texas, Penn State and Clemson were among the preseason national title favorites . the hoosiers and Hurricanes will play in the CFP national championship on Jan. 19 in the Hard Rock Stadium . they will play for their first title since 2001 .

title: Rams stave off Panthers in wild-card thriller to advance
content: the Rams have advanced to the divisional round of the playoffs for the second year in a row . the los Angeles Rams beat the Carolina Panthers 34-31 on saturday . quarterback Matthew Stafford said he would like to not throw it to their team .

title: The 10 teams that have gotten off to the hottest portal starts
content: college football's offseason transfer window opened one week ago . a dozen FBS programs have secured commitments from 20 or more players in the portal . there are 10 programs off to impressive starts in building up their rosters for 2026 .

title: CFP National Championship first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: Clock is ticking for Tottenham's Frank, with dwindling evidence he deserves extra time
content: 2-1 home defeat to aston villa ended their FA Cup campaign at the earliest possible opportunity . the previous Tottenham hotspur head coach survived last season by having a trophy to play for . however, he thinks his side should not get away with blaming injury .

title: Inside the day the Ravens moved on from Harbaugh, and what's next for Baltimore
content: it seems no one inside the Baltimore Ravens ' training facility had conviction that Tuesday would become the most shocking day in franchise history . the belief inside the building was that the Ravens would undergo staff changes, perhaps at the coordinator positions, but that Harbaugh would remain the head coach in 2026 .

title: Ja Morant trade guide: Four proposals for Memphis -- if it can find a suitor
content: sources tell ESPN's Shams Charania that a trade would end the franchise's tumultuous seven-year tenure in Memphis . the 26-year-old is averaging career lows in minutes, rebounds and 2- and 3-point percentages . he was suspended earlier this season for conduct detrimental to the team .

title: What's next for LaFleur, Brian Gutekunst after the Packers' wild-card loss?
content: the last time the Packers did anything with the contracts of coach Matt LaFleur and general manager Brian Gutekunst, it happened in relative secrecy . the news did not leak out until just before training camp in July that year . it was never clear why then-team president Mark Murphy tried to keep it a secret .

title: Two overreactions, two questions: Graziano, Solak make sense of Saturday's comebacks
content: the playoffs are officially underway, with the Rams just narrowly edging the Panthers and the Bears taking down their NFC North-rival Packers to kick off the action . we asked national NFL reporter Dan Graziano and NFL analyst Ben Solak to help size up every wild-card matchup from the opening round and look forward from all angles .

title: Sources: Ex-Auburn QB Knight joining Ole Miss
content: deuce Knight signed with the no. 6 Rebels on sunday . the 6-foot-4, 217-pound signal-caller spent much of the 2025 season . he was ranked the No. 2 dual-threat quarterback in the class of 2025 .

title: MLB offseason grades: Cubs nab Bregman on five-year deal
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future or a blockbuster trade, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Follow live: Bills
content: 4th & 9   50 CBS 172   Total Yards 124 1   Turnovers 1 9   1st Downs 7 4-25   Penalties 1-5 3/6   3rd Down 1/4 0/0   4th Down 0/1 1/1   Red Zone 1/2 17:11   Possession 11:35 Jacksonville ,  FL   62 ¬∞ Side Judge : James Coleman Field Judge : Dyrol Prioleau Back Judge : Greg Wilson Down Judge : Sarah Thomas Referee : Brad Allen Umpire : Mike Morton Line Judge : Walter Flowers Current Drive 8 plays, 22 yards, 3:21 (Shotgun) PENALTY on BUF, Delay of Game, 5 yards, enforced at JAX 45 - No Play. According to ESPN Analytics 12m 3m 1h
